title: Anti-Cancer Council ad: 'Have a fag'
brief_description: This television advertisment made by the Anti-Cancer Council of Victoria (now Cancer Council Victoria) formed part of the first Australian anti-tobacco advertising campaign which launched on 5 June 1971. Taking a stark and satirical tone, this campaign aimed to undermine the glamourisation of smoking created by cigarette company advertising.
